result.execSummary:
The defendant Cheryl J Pittman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Cheryl J Pittman in court with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 in 15 CM 497 and Ct. 1, Ct. 2, and Ct. 3 in 15 CM 422, Judgment to be entered, 15 CM 422 and 15 CM 497, Court withholds sentence, probation 3 years, 15 CM 422, 3 days jail w/Huber,  Jail start date 11/7/15 at 7:00 P.M., Ct. 1, $443.00 costs, Ct. 2, $243.00 costs, Ct. 3, $243.00 costs, $271.42 Restitution, Defendant to submit DNA Sample, 15 CM 497, Ct. 1, $443.00 costs,  Ct. 2, $243.00 costs, $77.00 Restitution, Defendant to submit DNA Sample
